conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric cutaway: walls extruded with thickness, multiple faces visible, and ceiling/roof removed to expose interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion, clear floor-to-wall separation, correct angled view, and clean cutaway with coherent wall geometry.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches (kitchen/living left, bedroom top-right, bath/closet core, stairs right, entry bottom-right). Minor proportional differences and some window/opening placement/size simplifications versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen, bed, dining, and bathroom fixtures are present and placed in correct rooms; some living-room furniture appears simplified/omitted compared to the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable geometry with clear walls/openings and good lighting. Text labels inside the render reduce presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Text labels (e.g., room names) are present in the 3D render, reducing presentation cleanliness.
Living-area furniture appears simplified/partially missing relative to the 2D plan (sofa/coffee table not clearly represented).
Some window/opening sizes and placements appear simplified compared to the 2D drawing.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with highly faithful room layout and wall geometry, with only minor simplifications in openings and furnishings plus label contamination.
